speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Once, when she was a girl... a very little girl... Dana was in the woods. It was autumn. She had always been a tomboy, unlike her sister Melissa. For her birthday, Dana’s brothers had given her a B.B. gun and were showing her how to use it. Their father had told them only to shoot cans... But in a patch of grass, Bill Jr. found a garter snake. And they began shooting. Wanting to fit in with her brothers, Dana also shot at the snake. It squirmed wildly, desperatly fighting for life but as the boys continued to shoot the snake began to bleed. When she realized what she had done... Dana began to cry with irrevocable guilt. Through her tears, she was saying that... something was missing from the snake. She had taken something that was not hers to take. And although deathly afraid of snakes, Dana held the animal as if sheer human will could keep it alive. The snake, its blood on her hands, died. There was nothing she could do to bring it back.

speaker: MULDER
line: It’s too soon, Mrs. Scully. We can’t give up.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: That day in the woods, I felt for my daughter. But at this moment, I know how my daughter felt.

speaker: NURSE
line: Sir... sir, you can’t go in there!

speaker: MULDER
line: Who...? Who brought her here? How did she get here?

speaker: NURSE
line: Sir, will you please...

speaker: MULDER
line: How did she get here?

speaker: NURSE
line: Ms. Scully was in this condition when I arrived for the evening shift. If you’ll step outside, perhaps Dr. Daly...

speaker: MULDER
line: Is that Daly? Are you Dr. Daly? What’s going on? How the hell did she get here?

speaker: DOCTOR DALY
line: Would you settle down...

speaker: MULDER
line: Was it, was it paramedics, FBI, military? Answer me right now!

speaker: MULDER
line: What, you’re telling me she just appeared?

speaker: DOCTOR DALY
line: Sir...

speaker: MULDER
line: Who did this to her!?

speaker: DOCTOR DALY
line: Sir...

speaker: MULDER
line: I want to see her admission forms. Who did this to her? I want to see what tests have been done! Listen, if you’re hiding anything, I swear, I will do anything, whatever it takes, I will find out what they did to her!

speaker: DOCTOR DALY
line: Presently, we have Dana listed under critical condition, comatose. There is complete unawareness of self or environment. There is no evidence of language comprehension, no evidence of voluntary responses to external stimuli. My apologies but... no one here can determine how Dana arrived at the hospital, administered and how she was attended to in such critical condition. Um... because of the absence of Dana’s recent medical history, I am at a loss for prognosis. I can’t determine with certainty how long she’s been in this state.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: You haven’t told us why she’s like this.

speaker: DOCTOR DALY
line: We just don’t know, Mrs. Scully. There are no indications of acute injuries, traumatic or non-traumatic, I can’t find any signs of degenerative or metabolic disorders. We have conducted every test possible.

speaker: MULDER
line: I’d like her examined for trace evidence.

speaker: DOCTOR DALY
line: She has been bathed and cleaned since her admittance. Also, there is a situation which I don’t know if you’re aware of. The F.B.I. has notified us of the terms of Dana’s living will.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: What is it, what did she say?

speaker: DOCTOR DALY
line: Well, Dana is a doctor. Her criteria for terminating life support is quite specific. She states that, um... if her glasgow outcome scale lists her...

speaker: MULDER
line: She doesn’t want to live in this condition.

speaker: DOCTOR DALY
line: You signed the will as her witness.

speaker: MELISSA SCULLY
line: I’ve been told not to call you Fox.

speaker: MULDER
line: By who?

speaker: MELISSA SCULLY
line: Dana, just now.

speaker: MULDER
line: Dana talked to you just now? If she talked, the EEG would have moved.

speaker: MELISSA SCULLY
line: Her soul is here. Hi, Mom.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: I’m glad you could come, Melissa.

speaker: MULDER
line: You’re Scully’s sister.

speaker: MELISSA SCULLY
line: Dana’s choosing whether... whether to remain or move on. You can feel her. Here.

speaker: MULDER
line: She’s not here.

speaker: MELISSA SCULLY
line: No, your anger and your... your fear’s blocking......any positive emotions she needs to feel.

speaker: MULDER
line: I need to do more than just wave my hands in the air.

speaker: NURSE
line: May I help you?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Uh, Dana Scully, please.

speaker: MULDER
line: Frohike?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Hey, Mulder. This is weird.

speaker: BYERS
line: Good work sneaking out these charts.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Snuck ‘em in my pants.

speaker: MULDER
line: There’s plenty of room down there.

speaker: LANGLY
line: You look down, Mulder. Tell you what, you’re welcome to come over Saturday night. We’re all hopping on the internet to nitpick the scientific inaccuracies of "Earth 2."

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m doing my laundry.

speaker: BYERS
line: The chart shows abnormal protein chains in the blood. The amino acid sequence is in a combination I’ve never seen before. I’ve downloaded Scully’s medical data to the newest Lone Gunman.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: He goes by the name "The Thinker."

speaker: BYERS
line: This guy’s a hacking genius.

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: BYERS
line: The Thinker reports the protein chains are a result of branched DNA.

speaker: MULDER
line: Branched DNA?

speaker: LANGLY
line: The cutting edge of genetic engineering.

speaker: BYERS
line: A biological equivalent of a silicon microchip.

speaker: LANGLY
line: This is way beyond cutting edge. This technology fifty years down the line.

speaker: MULDER
line: What’s it used for?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Could be a tracking system.

speaker: BYERS
line: Developmental stages of a biological marker.

speaker: MULDER
line: You mean a high-tech identity card?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Or something as insidious as grafting a human into something... inhuman.

speaker: BYERS
line: Good theories, gentlemen, but all for naught. This branched DNA is inactive. It’s waste product. Whoever was experimenting on Scully is finished. Now it’s nothing more than a biological poison.

speaker: MULDER
line: Will she live?

speaker: BYERS
line: Um... her immune system has been decimated and, uh... I doubt even a healthy human body has the ability to fight this. Mulder, there’s nothing you can do.

speaker: NURSE OWENS
line: Dana? Dana, honey? I know you can hear me. This is Nurse Owens. I’m here to take care of you, sweetheart, to watch over you. Help you find the way home. I know you’re far away from home tonight and that where you are is peaceful. It would be nice to stay but Dana, you must leave here only when it’s time. I’ll be here when you need me, dear.

speaker: NURSE
line: Excuse me, sir. I’m going to have to take some blood. Code blue crash cart!

speaker: MALE NURSE
line: Red wave coming in!

speaker: NURSE
line: Let’s go!

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Alright, let’s get an airway in!

speaker: NURSE
line: B.P. 80 over 60 and dropping.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Alright, let’s shock her. Give me the paddles. 200 joules. Clear!

speaker: NURSE
line: Clear!

speaker: DOCTOR
line: What do we got?

speaker: NURSE
line: nan

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Let’s go again, 260, clear!

speaker: NURSE
line: Clear!

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Come on!

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey!

speaker: X
line: Didn’t expect you here till after visiting hours.

speaker: MULDER
line: There was a man, he took Scully’s blood.

speaker: X
line: Forget him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Get that gun out of my face...

speaker: X
line: This high-capacity compact Sig Saver .40 caliber weapon is pointed at your head to stress my insistence that your search for who put your partner on that respirator desist immediately!

speaker: MULDER
line: You ignore my call for help and then you expect me to do what you say? You go to hell!

speaker: X
line: You got him killed! You got her killed. That’s not going to happen to me. You’re my tool, you understand? I come to you when I need you. Right now, you’re heading in a direction that can lead them right here.

speaker: MULDER
line: What the hell are you talking about?

speaker: X
line: You’re not supposed to know. That’s the point.

speaker: MULDER
line: I owe her more than just sitting around doing nothing.

speaker: X
line: She was a good soldier, Mulder, but there’s nothing you can do to bring her back.

speaker: MULDER
line: She’s not dead.

speaker: X
line: Listen to you. Listen. You’re a damn schoolboy, Mulder. You have no idea. No idea!

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay, then tell me. Tell me!

speaker: X
line: I used to be you. I was where you are now. But you’re not me, Mulder. I don’t think you have the heart. Walk away. Grieve for Scully and then never look back. You will be able to live with yourself, Mulder... on the day you die.

speaker: MULDER
line: Federal agent! Federal agent, don’t turn around. You know I’m armed. Put your gun very slowly on the ground. Put your hands behind your head and interlock your fingers. Turn right towards the machine and put your head on it. Face me. Who wants this? Who wants it? All right, let’s go. This way.

speaker: X
line: Stay there.

speaker: MULDER
line: Wait!

speaker: X
line: You want to see what it takes to find the truth, Agent Mulder? You want to know what I know? I’ll attend to this.

speaker: DOCTOR DALY
line: Discontinuing the respirator does not necessarily mean pulling the plug or ending her life. Karen Ann Quinlan lived for nine years after cessation of mechanical ventilation. I do believe, however, that this is not the case with your daughter, Mrs. Scully. My guess is that she’s been in this state since her disappearance and she will not improve.

speaker: MELISSA SCULLY
line: Is she below the criteria established in her will?

speaker: MULDER
line: It’s possible branched DNA can be treated with designer antibiotics.

speaker: DOCTOR DALY
line: Agent Mulder, I don’t know where you developed this bizarre diagnosis, but I do believe you’re in no position to continue your...

speaker: MULDER
line: You’ve never provided an answer as to why she’s here or what’s wrong with her. We need to study her.

speaker: MELISSA SCULLY
line: She’s not a piece of evidence.

speaker: MULDER
line: She’s here because of unnatural circumstances.

speaker: MELISSA SCULLY
line: She’s dying. That’s perfectly natural. We hide people in these rooms because we don’t want to look at death. We have machines prolong a life that should, that should end. That’s a much more unnatural circumstance than any cause of her death.

speaker: MULDER
line: That’s very politically correct.

speaker: MELISSA SCULLY
line: That’s very human. I love her. This is right.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Dana has made our decision. Fox... you and Dana had a friendship built on respect. Now, in the last year... I have lost my husband. And God knows I don’t want to lose my baby girl. But like you, I have always respected her. Fox... this is a moment for the family. But you can join us if you want.

speaker: CSM
line: Read it. It’s all there. If you’re having trouble sitting on Mulder, Assistant Director Skinner, I’m sure you know we’d have no trouble.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Uh-uh. Yeah, come in. Sit down. I called you right up here because of rumors about an incident at the hospital last night.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is this about the tooth that was found in the cafeteria jello?

speaker: SKINNER
line: The rumor has it that you were involved in the laundry room?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: A man was executed, Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: I was with Scully.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Traces of her blood were found at the scene.

speaker: MULDER
line: May I see the police report?

speaker: SKINNER
line: There is no police report of this incident, Agent Mulder, and there is no body. You know that.

speaker: MULDER
line: Since I am unfamiliar with any such incident, sir, no, how would I know that?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Knock it off!

speaker: MULDER
line: How’s it feel? Constant denial of everything, questions answered with a question.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I want to know what happened, damn it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Him. That’s what happened. Cancer Man! He’s responsible for what happened to Scully!

speaker: SKINNER
line: How do you know that?

speaker: MULDER
line: It’s a rumor. Who is he?

speaker: SKINNER
line: It’s not your...

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, you can have it all, you can have my badge, you can have the X-Files, just tell me where he is.

speaker: SKINNER
line: And then what? He sleeps with the fishes? We’re not the mafia, Agent Mulder. I know it’s easy to forget but we work for the Department of Justice.

speaker: MULDER
line: That’s what I want.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Scully was a fine officer. More than that, I liked her. I respected her. We all know the field we play on and we all know what can happen in the course of a game. If you were unprepared for all the potentials, then you shouldn’t step on the field.

speaker: MULDER
line: What if I... I knew the potential consequences but I... I never told her?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Then you’re as much to blame for her condition as... "The Cancer Man."

speaker: WILLIAM SCULLY
line: Hello, Starbuck. It’s Ahab. People would say to me, "Life is short." "Kids, they grow up fast," and "Before you know it, it’s over." I never listened. For me, life went at a proper pace. There were many rewards... until the moment that I knew, I... understood that... that I would never see you again... my little girl. Then my life felt as if it had been the length of one breath, one heartbeat. I never knew how much I loved my daughter until I could never tell her. At that moment, I would have traded every medal, every commendation, every promotion for... one more second with you. We’ll be together again, Starbuck. But not now. Soon.

speaker: NURSE OWENS
line: Dana? I know death is at arm’s reach tonight, but Dana? Your time is not over.

speaker: MELISSA SCULLY
line: You know, Fox… sorry, Mulder... you could spend the rest of your life finding every person who’s responsible and it’s still not going to bring her back. Whoever did this to her has an equal horror coming to them.

speaker: MULDER
line: Including myself?

speaker: WOMAN
line: Pardon me, sir, do you have change for the cigarette machine?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. Sorry, I don’t.

speaker: MELISSA SCULLY
line: What do you mean, yourself?

speaker: WOMAN
line: There’s a pack already here... Morley’s. Not my brand.

speaker: MAN ON TV
line: Want a cigarette, Rev? How ‘bout a smoke?

speaker: MULDER
line: Sit down!

speaker: CSM
line: How’d you find me?

speaker: MULDER
line: Shut up! Tonight, I ask the questions! You’re going to answer me, you son of a bitch!

speaker: CSM
line: Don’t try and threaten me, Mulder. I’ve watched presidents die.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why her? Why her and not me? Answer me!

speaker: CSM
line: I like you. I like her too. That’s why she was returned to you.

speaker: MULDER
line: You should be the one to die.

speaker: CSM
line: Why? Look at me. No wife, no family, some power. I’m in the game because I believe what I’m doing is right.

speaker: MULDER
line: Right? Who are you to decide what’s right?

speaker: CSM
line: Who are you? If people were to know the things I know, it would all fall apart. I told Skinner you shot the man in the hospital but I didn’t really believe it. And here you are with a gun to my head. I have more respect for you, Mulder. You’re becoming a player. You can kill me now, but you’ll never know the truth......and that’s why I’ll win. Don’t worry. This’ll be our secret. We wouldn’t want others to… start rumors.

speaker: SKINNER
line: When I started out, this is where they kept the copier.

speaker: MULDER
line: At least back then, it wasn’t just wasted space.

speaker: SKINNER
line: It’s unacceptable. Look, I know you feel responsible for Agent Scully, but I will not accept resignation and defeat as self-punishment.

speaker: MULDER
line: All the forensics, the field investigations, the eyewitness accounts... to still know nothing. To lose myself... and Scully. I hate what I’ve become.

speaker: SKINNER
line: When I was eighteen, I, uh... I went to Vietnam. I wasn’t drafted, Mulder, I... I enlisted in the Marine Corps the day of my eighteenth birthday. I did it on a blind faith. I did it because I believed it was the right thing to do. I don’t know, maybe I still do. Three weeks into my tour, a ten-year-old North Vietnamese boy walked into camp covered with grenades and I, uh... I blew his head off from a distance of ten yards. I lost my faith. Not in my country or in myself, but in everything. There was just no point to anything anymore. One night on patrol, we were, uh... caught... and everyone... everyone fell. I mean, everyone. I looked down... at my body... from outside of it. I didn’t recognize it at first. I watched the V.C. strip my uniform, take my weapon and I remained... in this thick jungle... peaceful... unafraid... watching my... my dead friends. Watching myself. In the morning, the corpsmen arrived and put me in a bodybag until... I guess they found a pulse. I woke in a Saigon hospital two weeks later. I’m afraid to look any further beyond that experience. You? You are not. Your resignation is unacceptable.

speaker: MULDER
line: You. You gave me Cancer Man’s location. You put your life in danger.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Mulder, every life, everyday is in danger. That’s just life.

speaker: X
line: Your plane ticket.

speaker: MULDER
line: But we barely know each other.

speaker: X
line: I can’t tell you why she was taken. It’s too close to me. I’m giving you the men who took her.

speaker: MULDER
line: How?

speaker: X
line: They believe you’ll be out of town. They believe you information they’ll search your apartment. They will be armed. You will be waiting.

speaker: MULDER
line: Waiting.

speaker: X
line: To defend yourself with terminal intensity. It’s the only way, Mulder. The law will not punish these people. After tonight, we cannot make contact for several weeks.

speaker: MELISSA SCULLY
line: Mulder. Sorry. I came by. You weren’t answering and your machine wasn’t on. Can I come in? For a second? Why is it so dark in here?

speaker: MULDER
line: Because the lights aren’t on.

speaker: MELISSA SCULLY
line: Okay. I just came from the hospital. Dr. Daly says... she’s weakening. It could be anytime. So I figured you’d want to come down and see her.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I can’t.

speaker: MELISSA SCULLY
line: Well, I’d think that you would.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, I would. I can’t, not right now.

speaker: MELISSA SCULLY
line: Listen. I don’t have to be psychic to see that you’re in a very dark place... much darker than where my sister is. Willingly walking deeper into darkness cannot help her at all. Only the light...

speaker: MULDER
line: Enough with the harmonic convergence crap, okay? You’re not saying anything to me.

speaker: MELISSA SCULLY
line: Why don’t you just drop your cynicism and your paranoia and your defeat. You know, just because it’s positive and good doesn’t make it silly or trite! Why is it so much easier for you to run around trying to get even than just expressing to her how you feel? I expect more from you. Dana expects more. Even if it doesn’t bring her back, at least she’ll know. And so will you.

speaker: MULDER
line: I feel, Scully... that you believe... you’re not ready to go. And you’ve always had the strength of your beliefs. I don’t know if my being here... will help bring you back. But I’m here.

speaker: NURSE AT DESK
line: I’ll look at the chart.

speaker: NURSE
line: Call Dr. Daly, now.

speaker: MULDER ON ANSWERING MACHINE
line: Hello, this is Fox Mulder. Leave a message...

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m here.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Hello, Fox.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not Fox, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: How you feeling?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I don’t remember anything... after Duane Barry...

speaker: MULDER
line: Doesn’t... doesn’t matter. Brought you a present. "Superstars of the Super Bowl."

speaker: SCULLY
line: I knew there was a reason to live.

speaker: MULDER
line: I know you want to get some rest, I... just came by to see... how you were doing and say hi.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder? I had the strength of your beliefs.

speaker: MULDER
line: I was holding this for you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thanks.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hmm. Could I see Nurse Owens? I’ve got something I’d like her to have.

speaker: NURSE
line: Nurse who?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Owens. Short with straight light brown hair? She watched over me in intensive care and I’d like to thank her.

speaker: NURSE
line: Dana, I’ve worked here for ten years and there’s no Nurse Owens at this hospital.
